most important quality an architect can

without optimism you can't do
architecture because it requires a

I wrote the op-ed because at that time
when I first began and even in the midst
of of designing the master plan for
ground zero there was so much
controversy what people wanted to rip
the master plan to pieces and and I
proposed some very powerful things which
included making that the center of the
site a civic space of a large scale I'm
not a private space
the memorial should be significant
should have the waterfalls it should
have their footprints but I also suggest
that it should go all the way down to
bedrock where where people really lost
their lives and the destroyable that
huge retaining wall should be made
visible to the public because it is a
documentary of the day and an important
point of orientation I also thought that
the buildings and I I didn't propose one
tall building or two tall buildings but
five buildings to stand occupying goes
ten million square feet of office space
to to echo in their positioning in the
grid as a spiral form at the torch of
Liberty in Lady Liberty's hand and that
power number one should be symbolic in
his height 1776 I thought you know no
tower will ever surpass that height
because that's the Declaration of
Independence in the skylight skyline of
New York somebody said let's put the
tower at the Wall Street let's have the
station in a different position
let's have narrow streets letter rather
than whites free let's cut the memorial
back let's make it smaller let's not go
all the way down to bedrock let's use
that space for infrastructure so there
are many different ideas that people
came up which maybe a more prosaic and
more easy to achieve but but I thought
no there is a spirit here the memorial
isn't just to be filled in with you know
bus parking underneath people should
have the sense of the verticality and
the depth of that event so that was
really you know there were many
arguments and and believe me as many
arguments as there are New Yorkers
everybody is their opinion everybody
knows what is right but but I stuck to
the master plan for Ground Zero
I think the response to rapid was good I
think people started thinking yes

to enter the memorial to look and be see
